intro: Anisocalyx limnanthiflorus, commonly known as the water lily of the genus Anisocalyx, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its showy, often white or pink flowers that bloom on long, slender stems. The plant typically grows in still or slow-moving freshwater environments, such as ponds and lakes. Its leaves are broad and floating, while its roots are anchored in the substrate. Anisocalyx limnanthiflorus plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small aquatic organisms.
